email_title: In case you forget your password
confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this trip ?
confirmMultiDelete: You're about to delete ${tripNumber} trips, are you sure ?
aboutText: Trainlog is an app aimed at storing and sharing public transport trips.
aboutItems1: All the data used is from OSM
aboutItems4_1: Train and ferry paths are created using a modified version of the OSRM
aboutItems4_2: Bus paths are stock OSRM routes.
aboutItems4_3: Air paths are simply a geodesic between arrival and departure
aboutItems5: All maps are displayed using the Leaflet library
aboutItems6: Languages other than English, French and Dutch are largely machine-generated, feel free to report inaccuracies in the Discord with the link at the bottom of this page
helpItems2_1: If a station isn't found by the search, you can create it manually
helpItems2_3_1: If coordinates aren't filled, the peg will default to [0,0], it can then be moved to the desired location
helpItems2_3_2: The country will be automatically retrieved using the position
helpItems2_4: If known to the system, the operator field will show the logo of the operator
helpItems2_5_1: For air, this field will search for the airline on an API and download its logo automatically
helpItems2_5_2: For the others, they are manually updated by the Admin
helpItems4_1: Green peg is origin, Red is destination
helpItems4_2: Once on the routing page, both origin and destination pegs can be moved
helpItems4_3: The router will snap to the closest way from the peg, including if it means very strange routes, it's sometimes good to move the peg around for more logical route
helpItems4_4: A click on the route will create a waypoint peg, it can then be moved to alter the route
helpItems4_5: You can use as many waypoints as necessary
helpItems4_6: The route will try to take the quickest way between origin and destination while passing through all the waypoints
helpItems4_7: The km displayed is the actual distance of the route
helpItems4_8: The data displayed is a guess at calculating a time taken by the route and represent a scenario where the vehicle would drive for the whole trip at the max speed and never stop, it can be seen as an theoretical minimum
helpItems4_10_1: Bus routes will drive on the appropriate side of the road, but as of now aren't able to use bus-only roads
helpItems4_10_2: Train routes will take the fastest way between the waypoints, but as of now ignores driving side
helpItems6_1: On save, distance traveled in each country will be calculated to be added to the stats
helpItems6_2_1: For Air, the distance is divided in 2 and attributed to origin and destination countries
helpItems8_1: On the trip pages (trips & projects), trips are displayed by default using a today as the top of the table
helpItems8_2: Trips where the start date is in the future are on the projects page
helpItems8_3: Columns are sortable by clicking on the header, and sortable by using the search field
helpItems8_4: Clicking on each row of the table will select it and show a menu bar for the selected trips
helpItems10_1: Once an trip is saved, some fields can be accessed through the edit button
helpItems10_2: The Vehicle Type is the actual vehicle model the trip has been traveled on :
helpItems10_3_1: For Air, if an ICAO aircraft type designator is detected, this field will show an outline of the airplane (ex: CRJ9)
helpItems10_4: The Registration is the registration number of the vehicle :
helpItems10_5_1: For Air, if formatted correctly (ex: PH-EZM):
helpItems10_5_2_1: The flag of the registration country will be displayed next to it
helpItems10_5_2_2: The registration will become a link to pictures of this actual aircraft
helpItems12_1: If you want to use the share functionnalities, you need to enable it in the settings
helpItems12_2: Each individual trip can be shared through the kebab menu on the right of the table
helpItems12_3: A complete voyage including several trips can be shared by selecting multiple trips and click on the "Create Link" button at the bottom
helpItems12_4_1: Please note that such link will crash if it contains one or more trips that have been deleted
helpItems14_1: In the settings, there is a possibility to export all the trips as a CSV
helpItems14_2_1: It is recommanded to do it from time to time in case of a catastrophic failure of the system, or in case the user deletes trips that weren't meant to be
helpItems14_3: There is also a possibility to import past flights from My Flightradar 24 logbook
helpItems16_1: Should you want to delete your account, it is currently not implemented directly, but please send an email to admin@trainlog.me and the Admin will proceed to the deletion of your account
helpItems18_1: Get advices, support and join community on the Trainlog Discord with the link below
error401Body: You don't have a ticket for this page. Please login or get the right permissions.
error404Body: Looks like this page went on its own trip! Maybe it's lounging on a beach somewhere?
error410Body: This trip link has reached its final destination and won't be embarking on any more journeys. It's permanently gone!
error500Body: Our servers have gone off track! We're working to get them back on route. Please try again later.
error503Body: Our database is busy right now. Please try again shortly.
error416Body: It seems like you've tried to mix a scheduled trip with an open-ended adventure, and now they're all tangled up! Please keep definite and indefinite trips separate. Let's try again, shall we?
errorDiscordMail: If the problem persists, please contact support at {supportEmail} or join us on the official Trainlog {discordLink}.

shareLevel0Details: Your account remains entirely private. No one can view any details or content.
shareLevel1Details: Individual trips can be shared using trip-IDs, hiding personal data. But the public profile remains inaccessible.
shareLevel2Details: Your public profile can be accessed via your username.

landingVisualizeDesc: Keeping track of your journeys made easy. See all your train, bus, ferry, and airplane journeys neatly on a map.
landingStatsDesc1: See a statistical breakdown of how, when, and where have you travelled.
landingStatsDesc2: Get useful statistics on your most frequently visited stations, most frequently used operators, and how much of your country's railway network have you been on.
landingShareDesc: Create shareable links about your trips to share your travel plans with anyone.
landingLeaderboardsDesc: Are you a frequent traveller? See how your travels stack up against other members worldwide.
landingInterestedDesc: Join a growing community of transit loggers
stopped: Trip started or ended in the zone
gpx_file_help_text: You can upload multiple GPX files at once.
alert_no_file_selected: Please select at least one file.
confirm_delete_gpx: Are you sure you want to delete this GPX file?
select_trip_type_instruction: Choose the type of trip for this GPX file:
failed_to_save_trip: Failed to save trip from GPX.
fineTuneNote: Note: The router is the same for train, tram, and metro. You may need to fine-tune the peg placement to get it to route on the desired path.
clearCacheLabel:
Clear the local trip cache.
Frees up space in your browser, but the first map reload will take longer
privacy_notice: By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy.
privacy_tldr: We do our best to respect your privacy. We donâ€™t sell your data to anyone. Trainlog doesnâ€™t run ads, isnâ€™t backed by any company or sponsor, and the only income comes from generous donations: buymeacoffee.com/trainlog.
privacy_intro: Boreal Baguette Studios ("we", "us", or "our") operates the Trainlog website and web application (the "Service"). We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data. This Privacy Policy explains clearly and transparently how we collect, use, and protect your information.
privacy_section_info_intro: To create an account and use Trainlog, we require you to provide:
privacy_section_info_trip_data: When you use Trainlog, you can store trip data including paths traveled, dates, and trip details. These are considered personal data and are securely stored within your account.
privacy_section_use_intro: We use your data exclusively to:
privacy_section_use_manage: Manage your account and authenticate your access.
privacy_section_use_store: Enable you to store, manage, and retrieve your personal trip records.
privacy_section_use_improve: Improve our service by analyzing anonymized usage patterns.
privacy_section_logs_content: We collect technical data (Log Data) automatically when you access our Service, including IP address, browser type, device information, and pages visited. We use a self-hosted analytics solution (Matomo), hosted securely by us, to better understand usage and enhance your experience. No third-party analytics or marketing services are involved.
privacy_section_cookies_intro: We use cookies and local browser storage exclusively for session management and performance purposes:
privacy_section_cookies_session: Cookies: used to manage user sessions and analytics.
privacy_section_cookies_cache: Local storage: used to cache data on your device, reducing data transfer and improving the responsiveness of the Service.
privacy_section_cookies_refuse: You can instruct your browser to refuse cookies, though doing so might limit your access to some functionality of the Service.
privacy_section_security_content: Your security matters to us. Passwords are encrypted, and your data is hosted securely in Switzerland by Infomaniak. While we take reasonable measures to safeguard your data, please note no method of electronic storage or online transmission is 100% secure.
privacy_section_thirdparty_content: We utilize both self-hosted and public instances of OpenStreetMap Routing Machine (OSRM) for routing and trip mapping. These instances do not have access to any personally identifiable user data, and we do not share your data with any other third parties.
privacy_section_rights_intro: You retain control over your personal data. At any time, you may:
privacy_section_rights_export: Request a complete export of your stored personal data.
privacy_section_rights_delete: Request immediate deletion of your account and associated data. Once requested, your data is promptly and permanently deleted from our servers.
privacy_section_age_content: Trainlog is not intended for use by individuals under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect data from users under 13. If you believe we might have personal information from or about a child under 13, please contact us immediately.
privacy_section_changes_content: We may periodically update this Privacy Policy. We recommend reviewing it occasionally. Changes will become effective immediately upon posting on this page, with the date clearly indicated above.
privacy_section_contact_content: For any questions or concerns about your privacy or this policy, please contact us at: admin@trainlog.me.
routing_tooltip: Process the GPX file through the routing tool, using each GPS reading as a waypoint.
appearOnGlobalText: Appear on the global live map (public transport only, personal trips are excluded)
